scenarioDescription:
The GSC 06214-00210 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GSC 06214-00210 is a star with 0.9 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.9 times its radius. It is located 353.88 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.005 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

GSC 06214-00210 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GSC 06214-00210 system


GSC 06214-00210 b

GSC 06214-00210 b was discovered by the Palomar Observatory observatory, in 2011-01, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 320.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GSC 06214-00210 b is 5088.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GSC 06214-00210 b is 20.176 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GSC 06214-00210 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GSC 06214-00210, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Palomar Observatory.
name: GSC 06214-00210 - System With 1 Exoplanet
